result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly S. Salrin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sawyer County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 18 months probation.  $100 fine plus costs totalling $579.00.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and follow all recommendations of mental health provider.  Report to DOC by 4:00 pm  4-13-15.

miscConds.notes: $379.00 fine.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$200 DNA surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Follow all recommendations of mental health provider.

judgments.dispoDesc: Ct #1 is amended to Misd Disorderly Conduct, DEF pleads No Contest, Found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on 18 months probation as per statute 973.09(2)(a)2.  Conditions of probation: Fine $100 plus costs totalling $579.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and follow recommendations of mental health provider.

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation
Granted-  Probation modified to discharge the DE from probation supervision on 6-30-2016
Copies distributed.
Attorney Thomas W. Duffy $509.88 cc:  Sandy H and client

Affidavit Regarding Fees and Expenses Due from County
Order for Payment Services and Expenses

Defendant Kimberly S. Salrin in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
Ct #1 is amended to Disorderly Conduct, DEF pleads No Contest, Found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on 18 months probation as per statute 973.09(2)(a)2.  Conditions of probation: Fine $100 plus costs totalling $579. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and follow recommendations of mental health provider.  
DEF pleads No Contest to Count #2, Found Guilty. Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on 18 months probation, concurrent with Ct #1.   Conditions of probation: Pay costs totalling $443.   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and follow recommendations of mental health provider.
Report to probation by 4:00 pm Monday April 13th.

Defendant Kimberly S. Salrin in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. need another month to resolve, Motion to lift no contact granted by court,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on February 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.
